speaker: UMPIRE
line: Play ball!

speaker: UMPIRE
line: Ball four! Take your base!

speaker: WHITE COACH
line: That's it, Moose! You're getting close now! Bring it, son!

speaker: PINEY
line: Moose couldn't find the plate if you nailed it to his ass.

speaker: WHITE COACH
line: Shut your pie hole, Piney. Kid's got to learn. Come straight over the top, Moose. Straight over the top. Come on!

speaker: CATCHER
line: Ah, damn. Exley's up. Back up! Exley's up! Back up!

speaker: JOSH EXLEY
line: You sure your boy got the right prescription in those spectacles?

speaker: CATCHER
line: Ah, don't worry, Ex. See, I told him to throw it right at your big, nappy, home-run-hitting head. So you can bet a hundred clams that ball's going anywhere but there.

speaker: UMPIRE
line: Foul! Foul ball! Foul! Foul ball!

speaker: UMPIRE
line: Ball!

speaker: WHITE COACH
line: Moose! Straight over the top.

speaker: PINEY
line: Over the top. Yes.

speaker: CATCHER
line: Hey, Ex. I heard the Yankees have been calling you.

speaker: JOSH EXLEY
line: I'm fine playing here in the Cactus league. It's nice and quiet.

speaker: UMPIRE
line: Ball! Leave the cactus alone, son!

speaker: CATCHER
line: Gee, I don't know, Ex. The Yanks could use those 60 home runs a year. Well, now that, uh, Jackie Robinson's up there in the Bigs people are saying you're going to be next. The first black Negro man of color in the American League. Shoot, Ex, you'll be famous, man.

speaker: JOSH EXLEY
line: I don't want to be no famous man. Just want to be a man.

speaker: GRAYS
line: Over the top! Over the top! Over the top, man!

speaker: UMPIRE
line: Home run! Home run!

speaker: JOSH EXLEY
line: Sixty-one.

speaker: GRAYS
line: I told you he could do it. I told you he could do it. Sixty-one.

speaker: WHITE COACH
line: What do you boys want? We're just playing a baseball game, here.

speaker: KKK RIDER
line: We got no beef with you, sir. It's that black Babe Ruth hiding behind you. Josh Exley. That's all we come for.

speaker: BLACK COACH
line: Well, you can't have him.

speaker: KKK RIDER
line: We heard the Yankees want to let a Nigger play ball so we just figure we're going to play with him a little bit some first. Now, all you Niggers and Nigger-lovers! You can go home! It's Ex we want.

speaker: WHITE COACH
line: That's what I'm talking about Moose-- straight over the top. Come on, straight over the top with it.

speaker: WHITE COACH
line: Come on, get the guns. Get the guns.

speaker: BLACK COACH
line: You boys ain't so tough without your shotguns, are you, fellows?

speaker: WHITE PLAYER
line: You ain't nothing but a coward. Hiding behind your mama's bedsheet. Let's see your face.

speaker: WHITE PLAYER
line: Holy mother of...

speaker: VIN SCULLY
line: It's a gorgeous day for baseball here in the City of Angels and I'm told it is a gorgeous day all over our republic today-- from Bangor to Bellflower, from Amarillo to Anchorage the sun is shining and it's a perfect day to play baseball... That ball is ripped... and it's going, going, gone...

speaker: JANITOR
line: Morning.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder, it is such a gorgeous day outside. Have you ever entertained the idea of trying to find life on this planet?

speaker: MULDER
line: I have seen the life on this planet, Scully and that is exactly why I am looking elsewhere.

speaker: MULDER
line: Did you bring enough ice cream to share with the rest of the class?

speaker: SCULLY
line: It's not ice cream. It's a nonfat tofutti rice dreamsicle.

speaker: MULDER
line: Ugh. Bet the air in my mouth tastes better than that. You sure know how to live it up, Scully.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Oh, you're Mr. Live-it-up. Mulder, you're really Mr. Squeeze-every-last-drop-out-of-this-sweet-life aren't you? On this precious Saturday you've got us grabbing life by the testes stealing reference books from the FBI library in order to go through New Mexico newspaper obituaries for the years 1940 to 1949 and for what joyful purpose?

speaker: MULDER
line: Looking for anomalies, Scully. Do you know how many so-called "flying disc" reports there were in New Mexico in the 1940s?

speaker: SCULLY
line: I don't care. Mulder, this is a needle in a haystack. These poor souls have been dead for 50 years. Let them rest in peace. Let sleeping dogs lie.

speaker: MULDER
line: No, I won't sit idly by as you hurl cliches at me. Preparation is the father of inspiration.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Necessity is the mother of invention.

speaker: MULDER
line: The road of excess leads to the palace of wisdom.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Eat, drink and be merry, for tomorrow we may die.

speaker: MULDER
line: I scream, you scream, we all scream for nonfat tofutti rice dreamsicles.

speaker: SCULLY
line: No-ho-ho-ho-ho-ho! Mulder!

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder!? You cheat. I can't believe that you've been reading about baseball this whole time.

speaker: MULDER
line: Reading the box scores, Scully. You'd like it. It's like the Pythagorean Theorem for jocks. It distills all the chaos and action of any game in the history of all baseball games into one tiny, perfect, rectangular sequence of numbers. I can look at this box and I can recreate exactly what happened on some sunny summer day back in 1947. It's like the numbers talk to me, they comfort me. They tell me that even though lots of things can change some things do remain the same. It's...

speaker: SCULLY
line: Boring. Mulder, can I ask you a personal question?

speaker: MULDER
line: Of course not.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Did your mother ever tell you to go outside and play? Mulder?

speaker: MULDER
line: Is that …Arthur... Dales...

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder?

speaker: MULDER
line: Ah... Choo!

speaker: SCULLY
line: You just defaced property of the U.S. Government.

speaker: SCULLY
line: You rebel.

speaker: OLD MAN
line: What in hell took you so long?

speaker: MULDER
line: I'm-I'm sorry, sir, I'm-I'm looking for Arthur Dales.

speaker: ARTHUR DALES
line: I'm Arthur Dales.

speaker: MULDER
line: No, you're not.

speaker: ARTHUR DALES
line: Don't be a wiseass, son.

speaker: MULDER
line: No, I-I'm sorry, sir, I know Arthur Dales and you're not Arthur Dales.

speaker: ARTHUR DALES
line: Arthur Dales is my brother. My name also happens to be Arthur Dales. It's the same name, different guy. The other Arthur, he moved to Florida the lucky bastard. Now, our parents weren't exactly big in the imagination department when it came to names. If it would help you wrapping your little head around this stupefying mystery, Agent Mulder we had a sister named Arthur, too and a goldfish.

speaker: MULDER
line: How do you know my name?

speaker: ARTHUR DALES
line: My brother told me all about you. He said you were the biggest jackass in the Bureau since he retired. Yeah, we're big fans. Sometimes we'd stay awake hours at night just talking about you. Just fascinating. Now, unless you're hiding some Chinese food let's call it a day.

speaker: MULDER
line: Mr. Dales, I have a, uh... I have a photo here of your brother. Maybe it's you. It's from many years ago and you're, you're standing in Roswell, New Mexico.

speaker: ARTHUR DALES
line: Roswell. That's me. I was a cop once in Roswell.

speaker: MULDER
line: Okay, and you're standing with Negro League legend Josh Exley who disappeared without a trace during a season in which he reportedly hit 60 home runs.

speaker: ARTHUR DALES
line: Sixty-one.

speaker: MULDER
line: 61 home runs in 1948.

speaker: ARTHUR DALES
line: Forty-seven.

speaker: MULDER
line: '47, whatever. I don't really care about the baseball, so much, sir. What I care about is this man in the picture with you. I believe to be an alien bounty hunter.

speaker: ARTHUR DALES
line: Of course you don't care about the baseball, Mr. Mulder. You only bothered my brother about the important things like government conspiracies and alien bounty hunters and the truth with a capital "T."

speaker: MULDER
line: Wait a minute. I like baseball.

speaker: ARTHUR DALES
line: You like baseball, huh?

speaker: MULDER
line: Yeah.

speaker: ARTHUR DALES
line: How many home runs did Mickey Mantle hit?

speaker: MULDER
line: A hundred and sixty-three.

speaker: MULDER
line: Righty. 373 lefty. 536 total.

speaker: ARTHUR DALES
line: What you fail to understand in your joyless myopia is that baseball is the key to life-- the Rosetta Stone, if you will. If you just understood baseball better all your other questions your, your... the, uh... the aliens, the conspiracies they would all, in their way be answered by the baseball gods.

speaker: MULDER
line: Yes, sir, that may be true. I'm thinking that your experience in Roswell could be germane to a conspiracy between men in our government and these shape-shifting alien beings.

speaker: ARTHUR DALES
line: Oh, don't bore me, son. My brother Arthur started the X-Files with the Federal Bureau of Obfuscation before you were born. He was working for the FBI hunting for aliens when you were watching My Best Friend's Martians. You say "shape-shifting." Agent Mulder, do you believe that love can make a man shape-shift?

speaker: MULDER
line: I guess... women change men all the time.

speaker: ARTHUR DALES
line: I'm not talking about women. I'm talking about love. Passion. Like the passion you have for proving extra-terrestrial life. Do you believe that that passion can change your very nature? Can make you shape-shift from a man into something other than a man?

speaker: MULDER
line: What exactly has your brother told you about me?

speaker: MULDER
line: Mr. Dales, if you and your brother have really known about this bounty hunter and plans for colonization for the last 50 years why the hell wouldn't you have told anybody?

speaker: ARTHUR DALES
line: Nobody'd believe me.

speaker: MULDER
line: I would have believed you.

speaker: ARTHUR DALES
line: You weren't... ripe.

speaker: MULDER
line: Not ripe? LET ME TELL YOU SOMETHING: I have been ripe for years. I am way past ripe. I'm so ripe I'm rotten. This cuts to the very heart of the mystery of what I've been doing with my life for the past ten years.

speaker: ARTHUR DALES
line: Oh, the heart of the mystery, the heart of the mystery. Ah, there you are.

speaker: ARTHUR DALES
line: Mr. Mulder-- maybe you'd better start paying a little less attention to the heart of the mystery and a little more attention to the mystery of the heart. You got a dime?

speaker: MULDER
line: What is this?

speaker: ARTHUR DALES
line: This little fellow goes by the name of Pete Rosebud. If you keep pumping coffee money into him he'll tell you a story about baseball and aliens and bounty hunters.

speaker: MULDER
line: You're making me feel like a child.

speaker: ARTHUR DALES
line: Perfect. That's exactly the right place to start from, then, isn't it? Now, the first thing you got to know about baseball is... it keeps you forever young.

speaker: YOUNG ARTHUR DALES
line: Mr. Exley? Mr. Exley, my name's Arthur Dales. I'm an employee of the Roswell police department.

speaker: JOSH EXLEY
line: Have I broken a law, sir?

speaker: BUCK JOHNSON
line: You stole … second base in the third inning. I'm a witness. Officer, I seen Ex steal... at least 50 bases this year.

speaker: YOUNG ARTHUR DALES
line: No, sir, you haven't broken any laws. Not that I'm aware of. Um, I've been assigned by my superiors to protect you against certain parties.

speaker: BUCK JOHNSON
line: I'm the one need protection from certain parties. Ex here,

speaker: JOSH EXLEY
line: I appreciate your concern, sir but I can protect myself.

speaker: YOUNG ARTHUR DALES
line: Mr. Exley, I'm not a big sports hero like yourself, sir and I really don't have an opinion on Negroes or Jews or Communists or even Canadians and vegetarians, for that matter but I cannot stomach the murder of a man of any persuasion or any color being flaunted and solicited in my town. Not on my watch. So you can be safe with me in a cell down at the precinct or you can be safe with me here on the bus. Seeing as how this is still America you're free to choose, sir.

speaker: YOUNG ARTHUR DALES
line: Vous etes sans coeur. Vous etes sans coeur, heart, Mademoiselle.]

speaker: BUCK JOHNSON
line: Hey, Officer Dales you're a decent man, ain't you?

speaker: YOUNG ARTHUR DALES
line: I try to be.

speaker: BUCK JOHNSON
line: Well, the fellas feel like the umps would treat us better if you got us eight more uniforms like these to play in.

speaker: YOUNG ARTHUR DALES
line: Yeah, you could change your name from the Roswell grays to the Roswell Black and Blues.

speaker: JOSH EXLEY
line: What's the matter, Arthur? You look like you ain't never seen a black man before.

speaker: MULDER
line: I've got to give it to you, Arthur. Calling a Negro league team from Roswell the Grays is pretty clever. E.T. steal home. E.T. steal home.

speaker: ARTHUR DALES
line: I didn't make that up.

speaker: MULDER
line: You seriously want me to believe that Josh Exley maybe one of the greatest ballplayers of all times, was an alien?

speaker: ARTHUR DALES
line: They're all aliens, Agent Mulder-- all the great ones.

speaker: MULDER
line: Babe Ruth was an alien?

speaker: ARTHUR DALES
line: Yeah.

speaker: MULDER
line: Joe DiMaggio?

speaker: ARTHUR DALES
line: Sure.

speaker: MULDER
line: Willie Mays?

speaker: ARTHUR DALES
line: Well, obviously.

speaker: MULDER
line: Mantle? Koufax? Gibson?

speaker: ARTHUR DALES
line: Bob or Kirk?

speaker: ARTHUR DALES
line: See, none of the great ones fit in-- not in this world, not in any other world.

speaker: ARTHUR DALES
line: They're all aliens, Mulder until they step between the white chalk lines-- until they step on the outfield grass.

speaker: ARTHUR DALES
line: Like clockwork. Poor boy with my medicine. Give the kid a tip, will ya?

speaker: MULDER
line: So I assume you're speaking metaphorically?

speaker: ARTHUR DALES
line: Speaking metaphorically is for young men like you, Agent MacGyver. I don't have time for that. I only have time to speak the truth.

speaker: POORBOY
line: You're a regular Rockefeller, ain't you?

speaker: POORBOY
line: If Ex hits a couple of dingers, that'll be 60. That ties The Babe.

speaker: BOY
line: Aw, that ball's worth nothing. Ex ain't a major leaguer, so the record don't count.

speaker: POORBOY
line: Does, too.

speaker: BOY
line: Does not.

speaker: POORBOY
line: It does, too.

speaker: BOY
line: It does not.

speaker: POORBOY
line: Does, too.

speaker: BOY
line: Does not.

speaker: POORBOY
line: Does...

speaker: BOY
line: Not.

speaker: BUCK JOHNSON
line: Perfect day for a ball game.

speaker: YOUNG ARTHUR DALES
line: There, uh... there was a bee on you.

speaker: JOSH EXLEY
line: Must have been a real big one.

speaker: YOUNG ARTHUR DALES
line: Could have ripped your head off.

speaker: JOSH EXLEY
line: Hey, Arthur... thanks.

speaker: BUCK JOHNSON
line: Officer Arthur Dales making the world safe for baseball and Negroes.

speaker: UMPIRE
line: Play ball.

speaker: JOSH EXLEY
line: Ow!

speaker: UMPIRE
line: Time! Time!

speaker: BLACK COACH
line: Do you know your name, son? Josh, do you know where you are?

speaker: BUCK JOHNSON
line: Josh, man, wake up.

speaker: BLACK COACH
line: Do you know where you're from?

speaker: JOSH EXLEY
line: Macon... Macon, Georgia?

speaker: OFFICER
line: Macon police department. Can I help you?

speaker: YOUNG ARTHUR DALES
line: Yeah, my name's Arthur Dales. I'm with the Roswell Police Department. I'm doing a background check on a gentlemen I believe is from your area. His name is Josh Exley.

speaker: OFFICER
line: You want information on a Josh Exley?

speaker: MAN
line: Yeah, the name rings a bell. Yeah, I got a Josh Exley. A six-year-old colored boy disappeared oh, maybe five years ago. Now do you got a read on this Josh Exley's whereabouts?

speaker: YOUNG ARTHUR DALES
line: Six years old?

speaker: TED THE LAB TECHNICIAN
line: You wanted to see me about running some chemical tests, Arthur?

speaker: YOUNG ARTHUR DALES
line: Yeah. Hold on. That would make him 11 now? No, that can't be the one.

speaker: TED THE LAB TECHNICIAN
line: I love my job.

speaker: YOUNG ARTHUR DALES
line: And is that all you have? Are you certain?

speaker: MAN
line: Certain as the sunrise. I'm sorry, son.

speaker: ALIEN BOUNTY HUNTER
line: Did you say where you were calling from?

speaker: YOUNG ARTHUR DALES
line: Roswell... Roswell, New Mexico.

speaker: ALIEN BOUNTY HUNTER
line: Roswell.

speaker: JOSH EXLEY
line: Hey, morning, Poorboy.

speaker: POORBOY
line: Morning, Ex. How's the melon?

speaker: JOSH EXLEY
line: My melon's fine. That boy throws like a lady.

speaker: POORBOY
line: I hear the Yankee scouts are here today. Going to hit numero 60?

speaker: JOSH EXLEY
line: Ain't no scouts here today.

speaker: POORBOY
line: Sure there are. Look. Right over there.

speaker: JOSH EXLEY
line: I'll be damned.

speaker: YOUNG ARTHUR DALES
line: Hey, kids. So how's it going?

speaker: POORBOY
line: Ex is stinking up the diamond.

speaker: YOUNG ARTHUR DALES
line: Oh, yeah?

speaker: POORBOY
line: Yeah.

speaker: YOUNG ARTHUR DALES
line: Well, anybody can have a bad day.

speaker: POORBOY
line: Yeah, but the Yankee scouts are in attendance today. I don't think they'll relish the idea of him being in the majors after such a piss-poor outing as this.

speaker: UMPIRE
line: Strike two!

speaker: UMPIRE
line: Two balls, two strikes now.

speaker: YOUNG ARTHUR DALES
line: Ex... Why did you tank that game today?

speaker: JOSH EXLEY
line: I won that game today.

speaker: YOUNG ARTHUR DALES
line: You tanked the game today. You want me to tell you why? Because your name's not Josh Exley. Josh Exley is a six-year-old kid who disappeared from Macon, Georgia about the same time that you showed up in Roswell.

speaker: JOSH EXLEY
line: I ain't never been to Macon.

speaker: YOUNG ARTHUR DALES
line: When you got beaned, you said you were from Macon.

speaker: JOSH EXLEY
line: Well, I also spoke tongues like I did when I was a little boy in church.

speaker: JOSH EXLEY
line: I was joking, Arthur. Relax.

speaker: YOUNG ARTHUR DALES
line: I'm relaxed. You're hiding something. That's why you don't dare get into the major leagues 'cause the sports writers and everybody would be digging around and they'd find out what it is, right? So you tanked the game in front of those scouts today. Disappointing those kids-- disappointing your teammates-disappointing your race...

speaker: JOSH EXLEY
line: Look here, don't go talking about my race. You don't know nothing about my race.

speaker: YOUNG ARTHUR DALES
line: I know that liars come in all colors. You got a secret, and famous or not I'm going to find out what it is.

speaker: JOSH EXLEY
line: While you're out chasing secrets you make sure you're chasing the right ones.

speaker: YOUNG ARTHUR DALES
line: Ex?

speaker: YOUNG ARTHUR DALES
line: Oh...

speaker: YOUNG ARTHUR DALES
line: Thank you.

speaker: GRAY ALIEN
line: This is ridiculous. You're supposed to be a big, bad policeman.

speaker: GRAY ALIEN
line: Now, hold up, Arthur. Now, before you go fainting again, listen to me. It's me, Arthur. It's Ex.

speaker: YOUNG ARTHUR DALES
line: This is an interesting dream. Wake up. Come on, Artie.

speaker: JOSH EXLEY AS GRAY ALIEN
line: Man, you ain't dreaming. This is what I really look like. This is the real me.

speaker: YOUNG ARTHUR DALES
line: Ex? It's really you under there, Ex?

speaker: YOUNG ARTHUR DALES
line: Ow!

speaker: JOSH EXLEY AS GRAY ALIEN
line: I'm not "under" anything, Arthur and I'm trying not to be insulted by your reaction to my true face. Look, would it be easier if I looked like this?

speaker: JOSH EXLEY AS SEXY BLONDE WOMAN
line: Would this be easier for you to handle?

speaker: YOUNG ARTHUR DALES
line: Mmm... No. Somehow, that's even weirder.

speaker: TEAMMATE
line: Bus leaves in five...

speaker: TEAMMATE
line: Ooh.

speaker: YOUNG ARTHUR DALES
line: So why did you, uh, leave your family in, uh... in Georgia?

speaker: JOSH EXLEY
line: My people guard their privacy zealously.

speaker: YOUNG ARTHUR DALES
line: I can understand that.

speaker: JOSH EXLEY
line: They don't like for us to intermingle with your people. Their philosophy is we stick to ourselves; you stick to yourselves-- everybody's happy.

speaker: YOUNG ARTHUR DALES
line: So what happened?

speaker: JOSH EXLEY
line: Well, you know what happened.

speaker: YOUNG ARTHUR DALES
line: You fell in love with an earth woman.

speaker: JOSH EXLEY
line: No. I saw a baseball game.

speaker: YOUNG ARTHUR DALES
line: Oh.

speaker: JOSH EXLEY
line: See, there's something you got to understand about my race. We don't have a word for laughter. We don't laugh. I don't know if you noticed in between all that fainting you was doing but we have very tiny mouths, so no smiling even.

speaker: YOUNG ARTHUR DALES
line: Wow.

speaker: JOSH EXLEY
line: I tell you, when I saw that baseball game being played this laughter just... it just rose up out of me. You know, the sound the ball makes when it hits the bat?

speaker: YOUNG ARTHUR DALES
line: Yeah.

speaker: JOSH EXLEY
line: It was like music to me. You know, the smell of the grass, 11 men-- first unnecessary thing I ever done in my life and I fell in love. I didn't know the unnecessary could feel so good. You know, the game was meaningless but it seemed to mean everything to me. It was useless, but perfect.

speaker: YOUNG ARTHUR DALES
line: Yeah, like, uh... like a rose.

speaker: JOSH EXLEY
line: Yeah, yeah, yeah, like a rose. See? You can get it, Arthur. You're a fan.

speaker: YOUNG ARTHUR DALES
line: Uh-huh.

speaker: JOSH EXLEY
line: Tell you, from that moment on I just couldn't fix myself to go home.

speaker: BUCK JOHNSON
line: Come on up here, Ex? Let's hear that beautiful voice you got on you.

speaker: TEAM
line: We'll all be together in that land We'll all be together in that land Where I'm bound oh, lord We'll all be together in that land We'll all be to...

speaker: MULDER
line: Let me get this straight: a free-spirited alien fell in love with baseball and ran away from the other non-fun-having aliens and made himself black, because that would prevent him from getting to the majors where his unspeakable secret might be discovered by an intrusive press and public and you're also implying that...

speaker: ARTHUR DALES
line: You certainly have a knack for turning chicken salad into chicken spit.

speaker: MULDER
line: You're also implying that this baseball-playing alien has something to do with the famous Roswell UFO crash of July '47, aren't you?

speaker: ARTHUR DALES
line: You're just dying to connect the dots aren't you, son? Look, I give you some wood and I ask you for a cabinet. You build me a cathedral. I don't want a cathedral. I like where I live. I just want a place to put my TV. Understand my drift?

speaker: MULDER
line: Drift it is, sir.

speaker: ARTHUR DALES
line: Trust the tale, Agent MacGyver not the teller. That which fascinates us is by definition true. Speaking metaphorically, of course.

speaker: MULDER
line: Okay, so was Ex a man who was metaphorically an alien or an alien who was metaphorically a man or a something in between that was literally an alien-human hybrid?

speaker: MULDER
line: It's official. I am a horse's ass.

speaker: ARTHUR DALES
line: What is it to be a human, Fox? Is it to have the chemistry of a man? In the universal scheme of things a dog's chemistry is nearly identical to that of a man. But is a dog like a man?

speaker: MULDER
line: Well, I have noticed over the course of time, a man and his dog will often start to look like one another.

speaker: ARTHUR DALES
line: Of course not. To be a man is to have the heart of a man. Ex had them all had them all, more than you or I.

speaker: YOUNG ARTHUR DALES
line: Dales. Ted?

speaker: TED THE LAB TECHNICIAN
line: Arthur, what the heck?

speaker: YOUNG ARTHUR DALES
line: Calm down. What is it?

speaker: TED THE LAB TECHNICIAN
line: This goo on the glove you gave me-- is this a joke?

speaker: YOUNG ARTHUR DALES
line: Why?

speaker: TED THE LAB TECHNICIAN
line: It's not like any chemical compound I've ever seen. It's from a life-form which doesn't seem to be carbon-based which, by the way, is impossible. This is way out of my league. I called to the FBI and the communicable disease center in Washington...

speaker: YOUNG ARTHUR DALES
line: Washington? Oh, no Ted, you didn't? Nobody was supposed to know about this. Can you... can you get the glove back to me?

speaker: TED THE LAB TECHNICIAN
line: Sure, soon as I finish up here.

speaker: JOSH EXLEY
line: I didn't mean to startle you. I'm Josh.

speaker: TED THE LAB TECHNICIAN
line: Oh, I know who you are. Only the best damn ball player west of the Bronx.

speaker: JOSH EXLEY
line: Oh, thank you, sir. Arthur sent me down here to explain this substance. That's my mitt it ruined.

speaker: TED THE LAB TECHNICIAN
line: Where is this stuff from? Where did you get it?

speaker: JOSH EXLEY
line: Mars. Actually, just to the left of Mars.

speaker: LAB TECHNICIAN
line: What do you think you're doing?!

speaker: YOUNG ARTHUR DALES
line: Ex? Ex, there's this fella down at the precinct who's willing to swear on his life that you killed a man this afternoon. Now, I'm not sure what's... what's going on here but I... I do know that you're no murderer. You're going to have to get out of town, Ex.

speaker: JOSH EXLEY
line: Life ain't like baseball, is it?

speaker: YOUNG ARTHUR DALES
line: No. No, it's not.

speaker: JOSH EXLEY
line: I had a talk with my relative. A good talk. He made me understand reason, Arthur. Family's more important than any game. So... I got to go home.

speaker: YOUNG ARTHUR DALES
line: You still consider them to be your family?

speaker: JOSH EXLEY
line: Of course I do. Who you think my family is?

speaker: YOUNG ARTHUR DALES
line: I don't know. Your team?

speaker: JOSH EXLEY
line: Don't get cornball on me, man. Next thing you'll be telling me is I owe it to all the little kids to break the home-run record, or I owe it to the black folks who think I'm one of them, to make it to the majors or I should just keep playing out of some meaningless human concept of pride or loyalty.

speaker: YOUNG ARTHUR DALES
line: I don't know, Ex.

speaker: JOSH EXLEY
line: We don't think like that, man. We may be able to look like y'all, but we ain't y'all. You know the big thing that separates us from you?

speaker: YOUNG ARTHUR DALES
line: What's that?

speaker: JOSH EXLEY
line: We got rhythm.

speaker: JOSH EXLEY
line: Hey... I better go.

speaker: YOUNG ARTHUR DALES
line: Yeah.

speaker: JOSH EXLEY
line: Hey... you do me a favor? Will you tell people what I did on the field? Will you tell your kids how I played the game?

speaker: YOUNG ARTHUR DALES
line: You know I will, Ex.

speaker: JOSH EXLEY
line: Hey, man, uh... one more thing.

speaker: YOUNG ARTHUR DALES
line: What?

speaker: JOSH EXLEY
line: You got a pretty good arm on you, boy.

speaker: OFFICER CORANADO
line: You may think you know the man, Dales but believe me, you do not know the man.

speaker: YOUNG ARTHUR DALES
line: You don't know what I know and you don't know what I don't know.

speaker: OFFICER CORONADO
line: This is no minor-league, Mexico cowboy cop crap. If I told you what was really going on you'd just stare at me in wild-eyed wonder and pee your pants like a baby. Now, tell me what I want to know. Where's Exley?

speaker: YOUNG ARTHUR DALES
line: I told you, he told me he was going home.

speaker: JOSH EXLEY
line: You sure your boy got the right prescription in those spectacles?

speaker: UMPIRE
line: Home run!

speaker: OFFICER CORANADO
line: I got a witness puts him at the murder scene. Now, I know they have a tendency to look alike but unless he's got a guy running around town looks identical to him he is a murderer, you could be an accomplice and the two of you fast sliding down a giant razor blade into a big old glass of lemonade.

speaker: OFFICER CORANADO
line: But, you hand him over... you can wear your big hat and that pretty badge as long as you want.

speaker: YOUNG ARTHUR DALES
line: Are we finished?

speaker: OFFICER CORANADO
line: No, Mr. Dales... You're finished.

speaker: BLACK COACH
line: God!

speaker: YOUNG ARTHUR DALES
line: Come on.

speaker: ALIEN BOUNTY HUNTER
line: It's over.

speaker: JOSH EXLEY
line: I know.

speaker: ALIEN BOUNTY HUNTER
line: I warned you. You didn't listen. Now you die.

speaker: JOSH EXLEY
line: It's the right thing to do.

speaker: ALIEN BOUNTY HUNTER
line: What do you know of the right thing to do? You-- who would risk exposing the entire project for a game? A game!

speaker: JOSH EXLEY
line: I hit a home run tonight.

speaker: ALIEN BOUNTY HUNTER
line: A home run?

speaker: JOSH EXLEY
line: Number 61. I set a record.

speaker: ALIEN BOUNTY HUNTER
line: Show me your true face so you can die with dignity. As your executioner I show you my true face before I kill you.

speaker: ALIEN BOUNTY HUNTER AS GRAY ALIEN
line: Show me your true face or you will die without honor.

speaker: JOSH EXLEY
line: This is my true face.

speaker: ALIEN BOUNTY HUNTER AS GRAY ALIEN
line: So be it.

speaker: YOUNG ARTHUR DALES
line: No! Stop!

speaker: YOUNG ARTHUR DALES
line: Ex?!

speaker: JOSH EXLEY
line: No... Let me be!

speaker: JOSH EXLEY
line: Don't. Get off me. Our blood is like acid to you people. Arthur, get away. Don't touch it.

speaker: YOUNG ARTHUR DALES
line: It's just blood, Ex. Look. It's just blood.

speaker: JOSH EXLEY
line: Wow.

speaker: SCULLY
line: So, uh... I get this message marked "urgent" on my answering service from one Fox Mantle telling me to come down to the park for a very special very early or very late birthday present. And, Mulder... I don't see any nicely wrapped presents lying around so, what gives?

speaker: MULDER
line: You've never hit a baseball, have you, Scully?

speaker: SCULLY
line: No, I guess I have, uh... found more necessary things to do with my time than... … slap a piece of horsehide with a stick.

speaker: MULDER
line: Get over here, Scully.

speaker: SCULLY
line: This my birthday present, Mulder? You shouldn't have.

speaker: MULDER
line: This ain't cheap. I'm paying that kid ten bucks an hour to shag balls.

speaker: MULDER
line: Hey, it's not a bad piece of ash, huh?

speaker: MULDER
line: The bat-talking about the bat. Now, don't strangle it. You just want to shake hands with it. "Hello, Mr. Bat. It's a pleasure to make your acquaintance." "Oh, no, no, Ms. Scully. The pleasure's all mine."

speaker: MULDER
line: Okay, now, we want to... we want to go hips before hands, okay? We want to stride forward and turn. That's all we're thinking about. So, we go hips... before hands, all right?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Okay.

speaker: MULDER
line: One more time.

speaker: MULDER
line: Hips... before hands, all right?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Yeah.

speaker: MULDER
line: What is it?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Hips before hands.

speaker: MULDER
line: Right. We're going to wait on the pitch. We're going to keep our eye on the ball. Then, we're just going to make contact. We're not going to think. We're just going to let it fly, Scully, okay?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mm-hmm.

speaker: MULDER
line: Ready?

speaker: SCULLY
line: I'm in the middle.

speaker: MULDER
line: All right, fire away, Poorboy.

speaker: MULDER
line: Ooh! That's good. All right, what you may find is you concentrate on hitting that little ball... The rest of the world just fades away-- all your everyday, nagging concerns.

speaker: MULDER
line: The ticking of your biological clock.

speaker: MULDER
line: How you probably couldn't afford that nice, new suede coat on a G-Woman's salary.

speaker: MULDER
line: How you threw away a promising career in medicine... … to hunt aliens with a crackpot, albeit brilliant, partner.

speaker: MULDER
line: Getting into the heart of a global conspiracy. Your obscenely overdue triple-X bill. Oh, I... I'm sorry, Scully. Those last two problems are mine, not yours.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Shut up, Mulder. I'm playing baseball.
